Stereo pair recording of 14 voices (fairly even mixture of male/female) for 2 minutes, featuring shouting, grumbling, and general riot noise - with some specific references to the play (e.g. "Gloucester").

name: Yet another Bar Crowd ambient funky mix.wav
description: I combined an ambient bar crowd recording that I found here with a funky little back beat that I also found on this site and made a great cubicle noise blocker / filter.I use this at work with headphones on when I'm trying to concentrate and drown out conversations in the office. Also good for when I work from home and I'm trying to drown out the TV and other distractions. The crowd noise is excellent at diffusing regular office conversation and the little funky back beat keeps the crowd noise from getting boring. This works really well even at fairly low volume i.e. you dont have to crank it loud to drown out the distractions.Hope you like it and thanks to everyone for the great sounds on this site.Combination of the following two files - Yet Another Bar Crowd - June 2007.wav (lonemonk)hip hop.wav(LS)PS - I purposely let the crowd noise run out for a few seconds at the end so that you can appreciate the full groove of the hip hop.wav. Has a nice effect when you loop the whole thing, gives you a little break from the crowd noise. Almost like you're stepping out of the room for a second.

name: Tokyo - Asakusa Sanja Matsuri
description:
Recorded at the 2007 Asakusa Sanja Matsuri, a festival held in Tokyo every May. Lots of chanting, clapping, lively crowd atmos etc.....ripped from video but quality is fine. Very occasional wind noise at the start and towards the end, don't think it's a problem though.
0.00 Procession. Shouting, flutes, bells.
0.38 Drums, chanting.
0.59 Clapping, chanting, some drums in background.
2.10 Some women cooing over a cute baby.
2.26 Clapping, chanting.
2.45 Women chanting.
2.52 Whistle blowing, chanting.
3.17 Slower chanting.
3.32 Drums, flute.
3.48 Chanting.
4.08 Drums,flute,crowd noise.
4.42 Chanting getting closer.
6.55 Close up chanting, literally a foot away. If you need a chant, this is the best bit. Starts with women then men gradually come in.
7.30 At night, getting rowdier. More chanting but different ambience, now in a narrow street. Ends with some nice synchronised crowd clapping.

name: 240413_2699_IT_City_walk_in_Florence
description:
City walk in Florence, Italy (binaural, please use headset for 3D effects). 
Here, I’m walking through the pedestrian downtown area of Florence (Italy), going in the street and crossing the very famous Ponte Vecchio. 
So, one can hear lots of tourists walking while chatting in different language. In the background, some noises from restaurants and shops along the street, and from time to time, a bicycle passes by. At #0:58, one can hear the voice of a man driving a horse carriage in my back, which will overpass on my left slightly after #1:35. Then, at #2:30, one can hear the beep of a taxi passing by slowly in the crowded area. 
At #4:17, I’m approaching the Ponte Vecchio (with many jewel shops on its side), which I’ll cross during about two minutes and a half. At #6:50, I’ll pass near a group of happy people celebrating a bridal shower. And finally, I’ll go out from the pedestrian area and meet traffic. 
Recorded in April 2024 with an Olympus LS-P4 and Ohrwurm 3D binaural microphones. 
Fade in/out and high pass filter at 60Hz -6dB/oct applied in Audacity. 
(If you want to use this sound as a mono audio file, you may have to delete one channel to avoid phase issues).

name: food_court_ambience_01.wav

name: Walking through the urban pedestrian street near the NewYear(5pm)
description: Related to https://freesound.org/people/lastraindrop/sounds/720507/ ,I held the recorder tightly in my hand and slowly walking through the street to record the spatial changes and soundscapes of the street. The sound is recorded at Wuxing Road Pedestrian Street in Liuzhou City, and the recording time is around 5pm on February 4, 2024. Walk from north to south through Jiefang Road Wuxing Commercial Pedestrian Street. This is a commercial pedestrian street, with not only shops on both sides, but also some snack and stalls. The sound mainly includes the voices of crowds and advertisements, as well as some other noises. At the same time, as the Chinese New Year approaches, you can hear some music and promotional advertisements on the street changing to a New Year style. Recording by Zoom H1n, weather: 4-8 ℃ cloudy day (February 4, 2024)

name: Walking through the urban pedestrian street near the NewYear(4pm)
description: identical with https://freesound.org/people/lastraindrop/sounds/728160/ (This is 4pm and that is 5pm),I held the recorder tightly in my hand and slowly walking through the street to record the spatial changes and soundscapes of the street. Due to the layout of the street, when I walked through the street with a handheld recorder, it was quieter for the first 4 minutes and more noisy for the last 6 minutes.The sound is recorded at Wuxing Road Pedestrian Street in Liuzhou City, and the recording time is around 4pm on February 4, 2024. Walk from south to north through Jiefang Road Wuxing Commercial Pedestrian Street. This is a commercial pedestrian street, with not only shops on both sides, but also some snack and stalls. name: church_wedding_ambiance_01.wav
description: Crowd ambiance noise. I lifted this from a video that I took of a family member's wedding. This was recorded during the time the wedding party was taking pictures before the ceremony. The microphone was located in the balcony. The church normally holds a couple hundred people; there were about 20-30 people in the room at the time. You hear people chattering and laughing as well as general room noise. I edited out some of the more annoying sounds that called attention to themselves like obvious coughing, doors slamming, and camera shutters clicking. I also added a little reverb to give it more presence and to muddy up the voices a little bit. There are very few discernable words in this sample. The idea was to produce a solid drone of noise that can be used as background atmosphere.

Noisy crowd waiting in a hall.

Fade in/out and high pass filter at 140Hz -6dB/oct applied in audacity.

Noisy crowd waiting for an outdoor event. 
I made this recording while standing in the middle of the crowd, during ‘’Parades Festival’’, which is held in Nanterre (near Paris, France) every year at the beginning of June. 
One can hear a lot of people (adults and children) waiting outdoor, for a street event which shall happen soon. Most of them are chatting in French, but some other languages can be heard. Between 3’00’’ and 4’07’’, a kid on the left complains quite loudly. 
Recorded in June 2023 with an Olympus LS-P4 and a Rode Stereo videomic X (SVMX). 
Fade in/out applied in Audacity.

name: 230714_2503_FR_Fireworks_on_Eiffel_Tower.wav
description:
Fireworks on Eiffel Tower, perspective from a bridge over La Seine river (binaural, please use headset for 3D effects). 
I made this recording during the evening of the French National Day (July 14th), from ‘’le Pont des Invalides’’, a bridge located in Paris, at about 1.6km from the Eiffel Tower, on which fireworks will take place. 
So, I’m standing in the middle of the bridge, just near the guardrail, over the river, with some ships cruising under my feet. The Eiffel Tower is at about 1 mile away right in front of me, on the left bank of the river. It’s lights are shining, then the fireworks start (on the tower and on the right side of the river too), and here is what you can hear : 
All around, thousands of people are watching and reacting, as fireworks and explosions are impressive. On the left, a photographer takes pictures. In the background, walla from the crowd, engines and some horns from vehicles moving slowly on the bridge in my back, some music from the surroundings (restaurants, boats, and phone), police siren at times... 
At about 18’00’’, the final fireworks will start, and at about 19’30’’, the crowd become really enthusiastic ! 
Recorded in July 2023 with an Olympus LS-P4 and Ohrwurm 3D binaural microphones. 
Fade in/out and high pass filter at 60Hz -6dB/oct applied in Audacity. 
(If you want to use this sound as a mono audio file, you may have to delete one channel to avoid phase issues).

name: Rainy Restaurant (Tribecca & Rain) AMB
description:
A busy Tribecca Standard restaurant with noisy people sitting inside and under an extended, concrete roof outside. Recorder was placed under the extended roof with one mic pointing inside towards the restaurant and the other pointed more towards the dripping, rainy weather outside. This added to the immersive, stereo, audio experience. Rainy, drippy, thunder, crowded, restaurant sounds.    

Technical Specifications: Recorded with a Zoom H6 recorder using the attached stereo XY microphones. The sound was post-processed to make it more crisp and impactful (basic EQ, dB adjustment and trimming on Reaper DAW). Recorded outside (field-recording) on a rainy and overcast afternoon in Pretoria, South Africa.

description: A simple recording of a night market in the city. I walked through the night market and recorded various sounds, including bustling crowds, vendors selling goods, chaotic music, and the roar of machines. There were also many types of stalls, including those selling specialties and crafts, snacks, and playing games (especially shooting balloons), and there were also many people, not only during winter vacation and weekends, but also during the Comic-Con at that time. Although the weather was a bit cold, it did not reducing people's enthusiasm. Overall, it is a portrayal of a night market in the city Recording by ZOOM H1n, recording at around 7pm on February 4, 2024.

name: NYC-diner-ambiance-ambience-by-EDLUNDART.wav
description: Over 5 minutes of background noise from a well-known New York City diner, including people talking, clanging plates and glasses and forks and knives and cups being cleared away by staff, and in the second half of the clip, radio ads playing faintly in the background. But crucially, no music is playing. This means you can either use this clean, or layer in your own rights-cleared music if you're using this in a film or whatever. Recorded in January 2019 with an iPhone X — don't let the recording device scare you, it sounds pretty good and certainly fine for this kind of background noise. Use it in any way you like for any purpose. UPDATE: I just uncovered a similar recording I made in 2016 at a different diner, and uploaded that here: https://freesound.org/people/edlundart/sounds/515719/ Pick whichever one you prefer, or use a combination of both! Warmly, Bard Edlund, edlundart.com

name: Manchester Airport Departures.wav
description: Ambience from the departure hall at Manchester Airport terminal 2 during the summer holidays. Voices of passengers, automated and human announcements, footsteps, luggage, air conditioning, noise from restaurants. Completely unremarkable in the best way. July 2018. Recorded with Voice Recorder on a Samsung Galaxy S8 smartphone and edited with Adobe Audition.

name: Busy cafeteria environment in university at noon - Ambient
description:
I recorded the sound in the central canteen of my university at noon. Compared to the evening, due to the rush of noon time, it is very busy, almost there were no empty seats. I recorded the sound during that period, you can feel the atmosphere in the sound.
The recording includes the sounds of people talking, eating, walking, as well as the noise of some devices. Because there are so many people, all the voices are almost intertwined, creating a noisy and busy atmosphere. The ordinary life of college students is like this.
Recorded by Zoom H1n, I clip the segments in the beginning and the end.

name: 240626_135822_FR_Noisy_audience_chatting_and_cheering
description:
Noisy audience chatting and cheering at the beginning of the show. 
Here we are in the most famous classic theatre hall in Paris (France), called La Commédie française, just before a junior national reading contest. I’m recording from the balcony located on the right side of the hall, so the audience is in front of me, and the stage on the right. 
First, one can hear the noisy and excited crowd (adults and children) chatting lively. Then, at #1:29, the audience starts cheering, and the French host come to the microphone and says ‘’Bonjour, bienvenue à tous !’’, which means ‘’Hello, welcome to everyone !’’. 
Recorded in June 2024 with a Zoom H6essential (built-in XY microphones). 
Fade in/out applied in Audacity.

name: Manchester Airport Departures 2.wav
description: More ambience of Manchester airport departures. Voices of passengers, announcements, footsteps, luggage, air conditioning, noise from restaurants. Completely unremarkable in the best way. July 2018. Recorded with Voice Recorder on a Samsung Galaxy S8 smartphone and edited with Adobe Audition.

description: A crowd of thousands of people chanting "Democracy" in Hebrew during a demonstration against government judicial overhaul in March 2023 in Tel Aviv, Israel. Recorded with iPhone 11 internal mics.

name: school assembly.aif
description: recording of a crowd at an assembly

name: 100+ People Watching a Football Match
description:
It's a recording of over 100 people watching a football match (Poland-Greece @ UEFA Euro 2012). Recorded in a medium-sized hall.

You can hear the sport live commentary broadcasted from television, people expressing their emotions with their voices. Clapping their hands, cheering their team (Poland) and generally making a lot of interesting noises as they watch the game.

Recorded with Zoom H2 in 2-channel surround mode. Originally 24-bit WAV, normalized and converted to 24-bit FLAC with Audacity.

I have reduced the mic gain at 0:56 to ensure I will not have a clipped recording.

I didn't edit the result to let you cut-out whatever you may need.

name: lounge bar.wav
description: One of the fanciest and most snobby Belgrade night lounges in Belgrade. I want YOU to use and abuse this sound as much as possible. This atmosphere was recorded from the street so maybe there is some of the traffic noise left in the background. But, when you think about it, who gives a damn! Enjoy and USE! Recorded with Zoom H4n. Please rate, comment and share. In case you download some of my sounds and use them in your audiovisual artwork, the only thing I ask from you is to let me know where and how they ended up. It would be a pleasure. Please feel free to send me a private message if you have any questions or suggestions. I really try to keep an open mind for everything. Thank you. Peace. Matt

name: Voices
description:
While working on another audiobook, I decided to make this sound.
It's 38 voices, each saying different things, panned around and mixed together, creating a "wall of sound" that speaks like 38 radio channels at once.

Recorded with a Zoom H2 via USB into Ardour2. Mixed and exported to FLAC with Ardour2.

PS: It's all Polish (with some possible German shout-outs), but the amount of noise makes it almost completely incomprehensible. Only a few words that are being yelled in a different voice can be understood. No sound repeats here, no recycling - every voice and every second of this recording is unique. Yes, it required quite a lot of work to record so much talking in quality! It's almost an entire audiobook squeezed into 5 minutes.

Strangely (or not) listening to this makes my mind rest, because the noise blocks all other sounds from the environment - making my mind free of stimulation, allowing for sleep-like rest state.

The signal is so much modulated that it appears to be not modulated at all - like static you get from a FM radio of you tune it wrong. The brain receives less data when you listen to this, than when you sit in a room hearing even faint (but distinct) noises from outside, other rooms, other people or yourself.
This is sound masking in action. A very interesting psychoacoustic property of human hearing.

Also: this is an interesting material to study of my voice's spectral energy distribution while speaking (as opposed to singing). As you can see using the spectrogram view, most energy is present in the band below 600 Hz.

name: LS_34159_PH_Manila.mp3
description:
Ramble in Manila, Philippines. (binaural, please use headset for 3D effect). 
This binaural audio file is one of the recordings I made in Manila a few days before Christmas 2018, while I was rambling in the shops and in the crowded streets of Divisoria and Baklaran, which are two places where you can find many sellers and vendors who sell everything you’d like to buy... 
Here, I’m just sitting in a calm place with some people talking in the small shops around, and in the distance, you can hear sounds coming from a crowded street. 
Recorded in December 2018 with an Olympus LS-3 and Soundman OKM I binaural microphones (version 2018). 
Fade in/out and high pass filter at 80Hz -6dB/oct applied in Audacity.

name: Tramway in Tula
description:
A tram (route 14) in an average Russian city (Tula) travelling 7 stops. Summer.

Recorded by Zoom H1n with it's stock windscreen.

Edited in Ardour:
0. Input
1. a-Compressor stereo (gainer):
   - Attack: 10ms
   - Release: 1000ms
   - Knee: 1dB
   - Ratio: 2.5
   - Threshold: -25dB
   - Makeup: 15dB
2. a-Compressor stereo (limiter):
   - Attack: 0.1ms
   - Release: 50ms
   - Knee: 0dB
   - Ratio: 2
   - Threshold: -3dB
   - Makeup: 0dB
3. Output

description: Snippets of digitized vinyl records recorded via USB. Those with IR in the names are or contain impulse response. Some may need editing or may not if you are experimenting. Some are looped some are not. All are taken from unofficial vintage vinyl at least as old as the early 1980's and beyond.

name: Church Sanctuary Light Crowd.m4a
description:
I recorded this inside the church building that I attend. This is about ten minutes before the morning service starts, so there's only a minimal amount of people. The sanctuary is large and I believe can fit up to 600 or more people inside. Somebody says hi to me as she passes by.
I don't have any microphones or sound equipment, but I use an audio editor called Hokusai and is the source for my future sound recordings. I experimented with the audio sounding by placing my phone on the floor beside where I was seated, so I hope this sound is usable.

It's an audience of about 1500 people applauding after a metal concert in a venue (013, which is the best venue for metal and hard rock concerts) in The Netherlands.

name: 130717_Krka_SwimmingHole_F_4824.wav
description:
Surround recording of the waterfalls in Krka/Croatia. Close-range recording of a swimming hole at the bottom of the falls, teeming with bathers from all sorts of (mostly slavic) countries. It is high summer, crickets are chirping audibly. A small brook flowing to the falls from right to left can be heard directly in front.
Recorded with a Zoom H2.
This file contains the front channels, recorded with a dispersion of 90°

name: 17.00_kolejorz_buglecall_150510.mp3
description: accidental documentation of spontaneous celebration of fans of the Poznan football team Lech-Kolejorz which won the Polish championship. Recordings are made by my friend from England Paul Vickers (he has used his camera) who was in the center of Poznan because of so called Annual Museums Night. It was on 15.05.2010. The celebration has placed on Old Market in Poznan&#324;. In this recording we can hear the Lech-Kolejorz bugle call that started the celebration and by the way the devastation of the center of Poznan. more on: http://miastodzwiekow.blogspot.com/2010/06/noc-kolejorza-i-noc-muzeow.html

Recordings are made by my friend from England Paul Vickers (he has used his camera) who was in the center of Poznan because of so called Annual Museums Night. It was on 15.05.2010. The celebration has placed on Old Market in Poznan. more on: http://miastodzwiekow.blogspot.com/2010/06/noc-kolejorza-i-noc-muzeow.html

Here, lots of rides around, and lots of teen-agers having fun !

Fade in/out and high pass filter at 140Hz -6dB/oct applied in audacity.

name: LS_34132_SA_JeddahAirport.mp3
description:
Ambience in Jeddah airport, Saudi Arabia (Binaural, please use headset for 3d effect). 
I made this recording while standing in the transit area of King Abdulaziz international  airport, located in Jeddah, Saoudi Arabia. 
In this audio file, you can hear airport announcements,  people talking several languages while passing by or standing, sounds coming from the duty free shops slightly on the right, and other typical sounds from an airport. 
Recorded in November 2018 with an Olympus LS-3 and Soundman OKM I binaural microphones (version 2018). 
Fade in/out and high pass filter 80Hz -6dB/oct applied in Audacity.

name: LS_34135_SA_JeddahAirportAnnouncements.mp3
description:
Flights announcement in Jeddah airport, Saudi Arabia (Binaural, please use headset for 3d effect). 
I made this recording while sitting in a waiting area of King Abdulaziz international  airport, located in Jeddah, Saoudi Arabia. 
Here,, I’m sitting just under a speaker in which you can hear some flights announcement in Arabic and English languages. Also, you can hear some people around talking several languages while waiting for their flights, people passing by, and other typical sounds from an airport. 
Recorded in November 2018 with an Olympus LS-3 and Soundman OKM I binaural microphones (version 2018). 
Fade in/out and high pass filter 80Hz -6dB/oct applied in Audacity.

name: 130717_Krka_SwimmingHole_R_4824.wav
description:
Surround recording of the waterfalls in Krka/Croatia. Close-range recording of a swimming hole at the bottom of the falls, teeming with bathers from all sorts of (mostly slavic) countries. It is high summer, crickets are chirping audibly. A small brook flowing to the falls from right to left can be heard directly in front.
Recorded with a Zoom H2.
This file contains the rear channels, recorded with a dispersion of 120°

name: 220521_1873_FR_BusyMarket.wav
description:
Standing in a busy market (1st file, binaural, please use headset for 3D effects). 
I made this recording in the Saturday downtown market, in Nanterre city (suburb of Paris, France). 
On this special day, the semi-indoor food market was really noisy, and I thought it would be interesting to record it. 
So, you can hear sellers promoting and selling their products, customers buying, and lot of people talking around me...
Recorded in May 2022 with an Olympus LS-P4 and Ohrwurm 3D binaural microphones. 
Fade in/out and high pass filter at 60Hz -6dB/oct applied in Audacity.

name: 220521_1874_FR_BusyMarket.wav
description:
Standing in a busy market (2nd file, binaural, please use headset for 3D effects). 
I recorded this audio in the Saturday downtown market, in Nanterre city (suburb of Paris, France). 
On this special day, the semi-indoor food market was really noisy, and I thought it would be interesting to record it. 
You can hear sellers promoting and selling their products, customers buying, and lot of people talking around me. For this second recording, there was a small coffee-shop just on my left, so you can also hear some customers talking, and the noisy coffee grinder/maker from 2’08’’ to 2’43’’. 
Recorded in May 2022 with an Olympus LS-P4 and Ohrwurm 3D binaural microphones. 
Fade in/out and high pass filter at 60Hz -6dB/oct applied in Audacity.

name: 220728_2070_FR_LivelySummerEvening.wav
description:
Lively summer evening at Le Barcarès, France. 
I made this 1 hour recording from the balcony of a flat located at the 3rd floor of a building, in the tourist spot of Le Barcarès (south-west of France), during a warm summer evening. 
At the beginning, one can hear lots of swifts flying and screaming in the clear skies, while tourists are walking, talking, and eating in the restaurants of this pedestrian street. Then, slowly, the swifts will become calm and sleep, while people will continue eating and chatting. From time to time, some dogs will bark and some vehicles will pass by. And finally, the atmosphere will become quieter, and tourists will go home. 
Recorded in July 2022 with an Olympus LS-P4 and Micbooster Clippy Stereo EM272 microphones (Primo em272), in AB position (about 40cm). 
Fade in/out and high pass filter at 60Hz -6dB/oct applied in Audacity. 
(If you want to use this sound as a mono audio file, you may have to delete one channel to avoid phase issues).

name: 210925_1684_FR_DowntownMarket.wav
description:
Down town market. (Binaural, please use headset for 3D effects)
I made this recording while walking in down town market of Nanterre, in the suburbs of Paris, France. 
The market is held every Saturday morning. Many sellers and buyers are French, but some of them are from North Africa (especially Morocco and Algeria), and they’re talking Arab language too. 
So, at the beginning of the recording, I start to walk from the street. Here, you can buy displays, , clothes, shoes, toys, bed sheets, kitchen tools, and many more ! It’s still quite calm. 
Then, at around 1’30’’, I’m coming in the semi-indoor market, where you can find vegetables, fruits, meat, fish, cheese, and many customers ! 
At about 3’30’’, I will exit, and go in the other side of the market, where you can find many things like shoes, clothes and kitchen tools again. 
Finally, I’m going back using another way, crossing again the busy semi-indoor market from 5’20’’ to 7’15’’, before coming back to my starting point. 
Hope you’ll enjoy the tour ! 
Recorded in September 2021 with an Olympus LS-P4 and Ohrwurm 3D binaural microphones. 
Fade in/out and high pass filter at 60Hz -6dB/oct applied in Audacity.

name: Noisy comprehensive market in the university
description: The sound was recorded at the university campus market. This is the 17th Youth Entrepreneurship Street Activity in Guilin University Of Electronic Technology, where many students were setting up stalls to do their own business. Some sell groceries, some do wholesale, some do game stall (such as shooting balloons), some sell anime or handmade craftwork, which are very mixed, basically mixing supermarkets, comic market, and amusement parks together. People are also using various methods to attract customers, such as singing, shouting or other advertisement. And besides students, there are also some parents and children among the customers. Of course, I also participated in it. The recording time is in 8:15 to 8:45(pm) on May 20, 2024. It's more commemorative than practical for the sound . Recording by Zoom H1N. Attachment: Some photos for display environment (some people have requested some blurring treatment)

name: VOC_220925-2130_FR_CannonShots.wav
description:
Eight cannon shots during a historical reconstitution. (Warning : wide dynamic range audio file !)
In the city of Rueil-Malmaison (near Paris, France), every 3 or 4 years, Emperor Napoleon, who was an important people in French History, is celebrated. During two days, people wear period costumes, and like to recall heroic battles of these times. 
Here, One can hear some of them demonstrating how they use an authentic old cannon in the park of Château de Malmaison (Malmaison Castle). So, eight cannon shots can be heard in total : at 0’00’’, 0’34’’, 0’45’’, 0’51’’, 1’01’’, 1’53’’, 2’11’’ and 2’23’’ . Well, looks like they’re happy to play with their big toy ! ;-) In the background, voices of people watching and walking in the surroundings. 
Please note that the dynamic range of this file is quite wide, so you’ll probably have to compress the audio if you’d like to use it in your project. 
Recorded in September 2022 with an Olympus LS-100 (internal microphones). 
Fade in/out applied in Audacity.

name: Bar Crowd - Logans Pub - Feb 2007.wav
description: Feb 24 2007 - Live at Logans Pub; Victoria BC, Canada (See Geotag). End of the evening, approximately 50 people remain of the original crowd. Ambient bar noise; People talking, finishing their drinks, and generally being drunk. Sounds of the bar staff cleaning up, bottles and glasses clinking, bands packing up their stuff. Gear: iRiver HP120 (Rockbox) - Sony ECM719.

name: Crowd and field noise before and during homerun hit at MLB baseball stadium
description:
Recorded at Target Field in Minneapolis Minnesota during Minnesota Twins home game vs. the Boston Red Sox on June 20, 2023. Crowd walla, crack of the bat, crowd cheer swell, stadium music and home run celebration noise, settles back into general crowd noise. Some voices distinct (someone yells "homer!" before the hit). Stadium music is mostly covered by crowd noise and, even though recorded music, is not necessarily distinguishable (be aware that copyrighted material is audible, however). 

Recorded from lower concourse, first base side, using Sennheiser binaural Ambeo headset into an iPhone 13 Pro Max via Hindenburg field recorder software. Exported into 24-bit broadcast WAV format with no processing other than normalizing volume to -23 LUFs.

name: Yet Another Bar Crowd - June 2007.wav
description: June 16 2007 - Live at Logan's Pub; Victoria BC, Canada (See Geotag). Much like my other crowd recordings, this is the end of the evening, approximately 50 people remain of the original crowd. Ambient bar noise; People talking, finishing their drinks, and generally being drunk. Sounds of the bar staff cleaning up, bottles and glasses clinking, bands packing up their stuff. What can I say? I like crowd noises, and I do a lot of Live sound recording, so I end up with a lot of this stuff. I also have some 44.1/24 stuff from this same show, but this 2-track version had a better perspective on the audience. Gear: iRiver HP120 (w/Rockbox) - Sony ECM719.

name: Crowded Venue
description:
A little longer recording of a crowded venue. Could be great sound background for a podcast of an audiodrama.

Captured with Zoom H2, edited with Audacity (I removed some bad noises or too close chatter).

name: basketball_crowd_noise_01.wav
description: High school basketball game recorded from the stands in a small gym.  Crowd sounds, basketballs bouncing, shoes squeaking, buzzers buzzing.  Lots of small sections can be lifted and looped for a wide variety of crowd ambiance noises.

name: Electronic noise in the City
description:
A device designed to help visually impaired people out by reading aloud urban transportation system information was producing a static buzzish sound. I wanted to capture it, however most of the sound is with lots of background noise.
It was the most crowded part of the City anyway.

Captured with Zoom H2.

name: Walking_through_large_crowd_stereo.wav
description: A clean raw stereo recording of about a thousand people chatting with each other. Includes distinct dialogue in American English, Iberian Spanish and other languages. Recorded in stereo on an H4n. I slowly walked through the crowd during this recording. Recorded in a big space with huge ceilings--would be suitable for a theatre, auditorium, rally, sports game, etc., but an experienced editor might be able to make this into an outdoor scene as well. There might be minimal handling noise.

name: Restaurant Atmosphere (crowded)
description:
Inside a crowded restaurant in Sao Paulo (Brazil) around midnight. People talking, some noise of the machines in background. 

Recorded in Bella Paulista, on 16th of March.
Recording by a MS Schoeps CCM41+CCM8 setup on a Cinela Suspension+windscreen.
Recorded on a Sound Devices 633
Original Recording in Wave 96kHz 24bit
Sound Ref: MS BR-180316T07

name: Mumbling crowd - people talking background sound
description:
Audio Description:

The audio captures a mumbling crowd, calm and peaceful, with people talking to each other in an open-air setting before an event starts. The ambiance is serene, with indistinct conversations blending together, creating a gentle murmur that evokes a sense of anticipation.

Possible Usage:

  • Film and Television: Ideal for scenes set in outdoor locations where a gathering of people is present, such as festivals, rallies, or outdoor ceremonies.
  • Sound Design: Perfect for creating background noise to enhance the realism of outdoor scenes in various audio projects.
  • Audio Productions: Suitable as a sound bed for podcasts, radio plays, or audio books that require the atmosphere of a peaceful crowd gathering.
  • Recording Date: 07/2024
  • Gear: ZOOM H5
Please rate it if you download the sound. Attribution and Conditions of Use For any use of this sound, kindly attribute by linking to us: imagefilm berlin You are permitted to incorporate this sound into all of your projects and credit where possible.

name: Large_crowd_medium_distance_stereo.wav
description: A clean raw stereo recording of a about a thousand people chatting with each other. Almost no distinct dialogue. Recorded in stereo on an H4n. The microphone was positioned on the side of the crowd, close but not in the crowd. Recorded in a big space with huge ceilings--would be suitable for a theatre, auditorium, rally, sports game, etc., but an experienced editor might be able to make this into an outdoor scene as well. There might be minimal handling noise.

name: noise#01.aif
description:
Couple of minutes of soccer/crowd noise at a feyenoord game, the kuip stadium in rotterdam, netherlands.
This was mixed for t.v. broadcast and quickly recorded to the line in of my macbook.
Neumann km 140 mics for crowd noise, sennheiser 416p's at the pitch, into a lawo mc66/2 desk. Stereo, dolby pro logic II encoded.

name: Passing crowd in Latin Quarter of Paris
description:
This is a simple recording of the passing crowd in the heart of the Latin Quarter of Paris, France, on a Wednesday evening between Christmas and New Year's Eve. The recording was made at the corner of the pedestrian Xavier Privas and Huchette streets, with the mics aimed diagonally across the street, about 4.5 feet above ground. By a happy coincidence (I'd like to say that I engineered it, but I didn't), this sound file loops seamlessly.

The clip includes the sounds of many people passing by (the area was very crowded), and some snippets of conversation, mostly in French, with a few other languages thrown in. Some faint traffic noise can be heard on the left, from the busy Quai Saint Michel street along the south bank of the Seine River, at the north end of the Xavier Privas street (left of the mics in this recording).

Recorded with a hand-held Zoom H4n, stereo, 96 kHz / 24 bits, built-in mics

name: 240730_220854_FR_Crowd_outdoor
description:
Crowd outdoor. 
I made this recording during a warm summer evening, in a square located in Bayeux (North-West of France), while a crowd is waiting for an outdoor event which will happen soon. 
One can hear people chatting in different languages, some kids playing, and some extra noises coming from the surroundings. 
Recorded in July 2024 with a Zoom H6essential (built-in XY microphones). 
Fade in/out applied in Audacity.

name: 240410_2691_IT_Tourists_at_Piazza_di_Duomo_in_Florence
description:
Tourists at Piazza di Duomo, Florence, Italy (binaural, please use headset for 3D effects). 
I made this recording standing at Piazza di Duomo (in Florence, Italy), during a nice spring day,  at about 11AM. 
One can hear lots of tourists chatting in different languages while walking, some of them are pulling luggage on the cobbled square, In the background, some noises from the surroundings like bicycles passing by, birds from time to time, typical sounds from restaurants getting ready for customers, cars honking in the distance, as well as a distant beep from a taxi going slowly through this crowded pedestrian area. 
Recorded in April 2024 with an Olympus LS-P4 and Ohrwurm 3D binaural microphones. 
Fade in/out and high pass filter at 60Hz -6dB/oct applied in Audacity. 
(If you want to use this sound as a mono audio file, you may have to delete one channel to avoid phase issues).

name: boqueria_parada_marisc.mp3
description: Sound recorded from the front of the seafood store in the center of the market of La Boqueria. You hear the rumor from the crowd as a background of the market one Saturday morning and the noise of machinery and equipment used by the merchants. Several people passing by the seafood store are surprised because many animals are alive. Talks are in different languages because it is full of tourists. There is a group of musicians, oh, oh! They almost cannot walk among the people, but they laugh, sing and bring a hat to see if people put some coins. Recorded with a Sony PCM-D50 and microphones built. Date and time of the recorded sound: 2009-04-04 13:30:34. sonsdebarcelona's user: tarari

name: portobetter.mp3
description:
A walk through the Portobello Road street market in London, summer, 2004. Lots of crowd noise, a street vendor at the beginning ("'ave a look!"), a train passing overhead in the middle of the clip, and a number of people talking as they passed me. Many of them were talking Russian, for some reason. Music from a vendor's boom box in the background of the last half.
Recorded on a Sharp MD recorder (MD-MT90) with SoundPro stereo mic.

name: FremontSolstice2007A.wav
description: I put a recording machine in my backpack and walked around the parade staging area for the Fremont Solstice Parade on June 16 2007. Various instruments are heard, as well as usual crowd noises.

name: Changi Airport 1.mp3
description: This is just over 6 minutes of sound from Changi Airport (Termnial 1) walking around the duty-free shopping area. This is a carpeted space and one of the busiest international hubs. The 'white noise' you can hear in a few places are water-falls and water features. A few announcements can be heard along with snippets of various conversations in the crowd, these become more frequent at in the second half of the recording. Recording chain: Sound Professionals SP-TFB-2 Binaural Microphones (in ear) -> Edirol R-09 (mic in, level 10) -> 256 kbps (to keep the file size down)
